basics.name: Kenneth Lauritzen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2019.

work.summary: Head of online presence for Ka Leo newspaper. Develop the website as well as the mobile app.
highlights: Maintain, update, and oversee official college newspaper website
Drive, design and build student-community projects for UH Manoa
Assist in designing hardware systems and electrical circuits for a variety of applications
Source many components that will be used for real-world designs., and can provide a reliable, consistent product for the clients

volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design hardware for distributed weather sensor network
Assist in firmware development for the weather sensor nodes

volunteer.summary: Helped develop an application which creates and online portfolio. Aimed at helping students create a portfolio website without the need for web development or experience in coding
highlights: Resolved various bugs and enhancements across the platform
Added support for image manipulation. Written code to allow users to add, remove, update, and edit images throughout their articles

awards.title: Hawaii Annual Code Challenge - 2nd Place
awards.summary: Created a mobile application that uses machine vision to identify plant species and relay relavent information about the plant back the user. Used for identifying rare, endemic plantlife throughout Hawaii.
